body_text:
Yeah, you're right. You can drop upgrade insecure (it was added to help legacy sites upgrade to https).

Moreover, it means that upgrade-insecure-requests’s effect takes place before the block-all-mixed-content directive would have a chance to block the request. If the former is set, the latter is effectively a no-op.

https://www.w3.org/TR/upgrade-insecure-requests/#mix
https://www.w3.org/TR/upgrade-insecure-requests/#recommendations
